SENT.plain: Hepatic tumors unassociated with cirrhosis were encountered in seven patients aged 10 to 19 years
Four patients had received androgens for aplastic anemia
One patient had had a renal transplant 2 1/2 years ago
Two patients are alive at 2 3/4 and 2 1/2 years after surgical resections
Nodules were found at autopsy in the others
The tumors were well differentiated and, in the androgen-related cases, differed from the others in the following features: canalicular bile retention, mild nuclear atypia, and acinar formation
No mitoses, vascular invasion, or metastatic tumor were evident
The clinical setting was variable; different factors, including iron overload and androgen therapy, played a role in the development of tumor
Although the androgen-related cases showed mild cellular atypia, biologic evidence of malignancy was lacking as in most previous reports
